top_categories.workout_context: 79ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
At Salida 76, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
Salida 76's Colorado Rockies, Mountain gravel forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 76 miles.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Salida 76. Train it until it feels boring.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Salida 76's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before September.
6,000ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
6,000ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
76 miles on Colorado Rockies gravel burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
Base fitness for Salida 76. Without this, the hard workouts break you down instead of building you up.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Salida 76, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Low-cadence force work for 6,000ft of climbing. The slow, grinding ascents where you can't spin—you push.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Salida 76’s 76 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Salida 76. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Salida 76 requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on colorado rockies gravel to build confidence. Expect: colorado rockies, mountain gravel, high altitude.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Over Under, and Gravel Specific to prepare you for 76 miles of colorado rockies gravel in Salida, CO.
